Candidate :  Abrar Hakeem  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Netherlands - Rotterdam  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
PhD (Catalysis Engineering, Delft University of Technology, Delft, Netherlands) 2014  
Catalyst development for hydrogen production at industrial conditions for energy efficient applications.  
• Developed a highly active and sta ble heterogeneous catalyst, which outperformed commercially 
available high temperature shift catalyst.  
• Design, operation and troubleshooting of the high throughput reactor unit (200 bar and 600oC).  
• Heterogeneous catalyst preparation techniques and stud y of reaction mechanisms.  
• Kinetic modeling, design of experiments and theoretical predictions using density functional 
theory.  
• Hands -on experience in catalyst characterization te  
  
Candidate :  Abrar Hakeem  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Netherlands - Rotterdam  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
PhD (Catalysis Engineering, Delft University of Technology, Delft, Netherlands) 2014  
Catalyst development for hydrogen production at industrial conditions for energy efficient applications.  
• Developed a highly active and sta ble heterogeneous catalyst, which outperformed commercially 
available high temperature shift catalyst.  
• Design, operation and troubleshooting of the high throughput reactor unit (200 bar and 600oC).  
• Heterogeneous catalyst preparation techniques and stud y of reaction mechanisms.  
• Kinetic modeling, design of experiments and theoretical predictions using density functional 
theory.  
• Hands -on experience in catalyst characterization techniques (e.g. XPS, XRD, TPD/TPR/TPO, 
operando DRIFTS, NH3 TPD, GC -MS, SEM -EDX and TGA -MS).  
• Supervised and designed projects for master (five) and bachelor (three) students.  
• Teaching assistant for two years in MSc course on Reactors and Kinetics at TU Delft.  
 
 
M.Tech Chemical Engineering Indian Insti tute of Technology  2010  
Flexible temperature sensor fabrication by using conducting polymers. The work includes synthesis, 
characterization, analysis and processing of conducting polymers.  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2018 – Present Q8 Research  
Position: Research Scientist  
• Leading projects for refinery resid hydroprocessing (Each project approx. € 250k).  
• Design of high throughput experiments, data analysis, kinetic models and reporting.  
• Planning and coordination with catalyst vendors.  
• Managing project with team of technicians and analytical staff.  
• Secured funding for two research projects for European C onsortium Projects (Hydrogen storage 
& transportation and Biofuels) in collaboration with different companies / universities. (Total € 
7.5 million).  
• Project proposals for catalyst testing in 16x high throughput reactor unit for KNPC, external 
companies a nd EU research consortiums. (Each worth € 200k -500k).  
• Analyzing problem statements, offering solutions and developing plan of experimental 
work.  
 • Developed methods and lead project in Catalyst Quality Control of regenerated 
hydroprocessing catalysts for  Zeeland Refinery. (€ 25k)  
• Project lead for catalyst particle sorting and analysis performed by a customized robot.(€ 100k)  
• Consultant: Technical feasibility on processes for alternate fuels (bio fuels & hydrogen).  
 
2014 – 2018 Sabic Technology & Inn ovation Europe  
Position: Scienti st 
• Managed hydroprocessing and chemi cal projects at hte (High Throughput Experimentation 
Company, Germany) for SABIC global with highly efficient utilization of reactor units and 
implementation.  
• Lead and completed tasks for multiple projects for production of petrochemicals via different 
routes (dehydrogenation, hydrocracking & hydrotreatment).  
• Troubleshooting the experimental rig, experimental design, data analysis and analytical 
methods.  
• Managed a plant trial for plastic waste pyrolysis project in Avonmouth, Bristol, UK. The 
developed  catalytic process was implemented in Naphtha Cracker (Circular Economy).  
• Developing sampling protocols, data analysis, analytical methods and planning.  
• Completed technical assignment in US to upgrade waste stream in Phenol production plant.  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Project leader and enthusiastic researcher with a chemical engineering background & PhD in catalysis 
engineering. 7+ years of industrial research experience in chemical, petrochemical and refinery 
catalytic applications. Assignments completed in US, UK, India and within Europe for different projects 
(refinery, petrochemicals & sustainability) which lead to implementation of novel efficient processes and 
added value to the company. Leading hydroprocessing catalysis research projects with major catalyst 
manufacturers  / technology licensors. Hands -on experience in commercial pilot plants, high throughput 
catalyst testing units, micro flow reactors, setting up research facilities, catalyst characterization and 
research analytical techniques.  
 
Publications (Scientific & Tec

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
